$ASTS successfully deployed BlueBird 6 which is the largest commercial communications antenna ever put into low Earth orbit.

The 2,400 sq ft deployment is a major derisking milestone for Block 2 which is 3.5x larger than the earlier Block 1 satellites.

$AMZN disclosed a ~5% stake in eVTOL logistics company $BETA.

Beta designs and builds electric aircraft, propulsion systems and charging infrastructure.

The AI Tsunami is flattening all software into one bucket but a handful of AI application winners will emerge from this cycle as true platform-scale businesses. 

$PLTR has already cemented itself as one of those winners and with three straight quarters of accelerating RPO at 39%, 43% and now 48%, $NET is starting to look like another one.

$NET just reported its largest RPO growth (+48% YoY) in over three years. 

This is a software platform proving it can win in the AI economy by monetizing the control layer that agents must pass through to access data, APIs & users in real time.

üì∫ ROTATION IS HERE‚Ä¶ & METALS ARE MOVING AGAIN

The market is heading into Jobs Wednesday with expectations already leaning toward a June rate cut.

We are no longer in the same environment where the Mag 7 carried everything: mid-caps $MDY are making new highs, industrials are pushing higher, small caps $IWM are acting well, $DOW is pressing toward 50,000.

That‚Äôs a healthy rotation. Broader participation.

Now the real question: can $SPX hold key levels again as it did before? Previously, it held above 6,880 and chopped sideways before pushing higher. Now the focus is around 6,916. If it holds and digests again, the next logical move is a push toward new highs ‚Äî similar to what the Dow already achieved.

Meanwhile, metals are on the move. $SLV had a strong buy signal recently. Now some traders are looking to rebuy silver around the $72‚Äì$76 area. It has room if momentum continues.

$GLD is acting even better. Gold needs to hold the 4,600 area to move higher.

A lot to do as we prepare/trade/manage 
Then I head to NYSE to see @LizClaman @FoxBusiness for 3:00 segment.

It's WASDE Day

 The USDA will release the report at 12:00 noon ET.

Analysts expect slightly tighter US grain and oilseed supplies ahead of the February WASDE report. 

Pre-report surveys indicate lower estimates for US corn, soybean, and wheat ending stocks compared to January's report. 

Conversely, analysts project slightly higher world ending stocks for all three commodities.

Source: Bloomberg

The WASDE Report is out

Small snack for corn bulls...

Exports increased by 100 mln bushels. With no other changes ending stocks decreased by the same amount.
